bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO

This cause coming on for hearing upon the application of Junichi Yamamoto for a writ of habeas corpus, and this court hav- ing issued an order directing Luther Weedin, United States Com- missioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, to show cause why a writ of habeas corpus should not issue in the above entit- led court and that the said petitioner be discharged and the said Luther Weedin, as such commissioner, having filed his return here- in and the above entitled cause having been submitted to this court for decision upon the said petition and upon said return,

NOW, THEREFORE, it is hereby ORDERED that the petition of Junichi Yamamoto be and the same is hereby denied and the said petitioner is hereby remanded to the custody of the said United States Immigration Commissioner, and the said petitioner is hereby directed to surrender himself to the said commissioner for de- portation to Japan.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that said petitioner be and he is hereby allowed to appeal from this order to the Supreme Court of the United States or to the Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, at any time within a period of thirty days from the date of the entry of this order.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 6th day of May, 1922.
OK as to fore, Gates and Helsell
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
